title.narrative: Final evalutation of OECD Sector Comp Strategy
Slutlig utvärdering av OECD Sector Comp Strategy

description.narrative:
2009 ingick Ambassaden i Kyiv i ett långvarigt project med OECD som syftade till att förbättra Ukrainas konkurrenskraft och öka attraktionskraften för utländska direktinvesteringar. Projektet var uppdelat i tre faser,med separate mål och aktiviteter.
För att ta tillvara lärdomar från implementeringen av projekten ämnar ambassaden göra en utvärdering, med primärt på effektivitiet i genomförande och metod. Tanken är en framåtblickade utvärdering med lärdomar för eventuell kommande programmering.

The embassy in Kyiv, Ukraine hasprocured consulting services to conduct an evaluation of a recently ended project as defined below. The procurement will be made in accordance with the existing framework agreement on agriculture, employment and market development (archive number 14/001220).
In 2009 the Embassy in Kyiv entered into a long-term programme with OECD aiming at enhancing Ukraine’s competitiveness and Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) appeal. The programme was divided into three phases, each with separate aims and objectives.
To enable effective future programming and use of lessons learned, the embassy aims to conduct an evaluation primarily focusing on effectiveness in implementation and methods used. The idea is to have a forward looking evaluation.
Niras/Indevelop AB has been awarded the contract.

The main purpose of the evaluation is to review the achievements, effectiveness, efficiency, quality, sustainability and effects to date of Phase III of the Sida- and EUfunded OECD Sector Competitiveness Strategy Project in Ukraine. The previous phases were to be examined only to the extent necessary to evaluate Phase III and to assess the overall programme approach and “the efficiency of OECD as a partner”

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: On the whole the evaluaton team performed well given the constraints of the assignment. Difficulties were encountered in accessing the local stakeholders due to a large changeover of staff at the Ministry of Economy. The Embassy had not stipulated a requirement for an evaluation in the agreement with OECD, nor had the ToR been shared with OECD for approval. As such the element of assessing the financial effectivness of the programme to be evaluated was removed from the evaluation as this was against OECD regulations. The evaluation was shared with the EU delegation who did not show particular interest or provide any comments. Despite this the qualitative evaluation of the contribution was of a high standard and useful to the Embassy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
